snippet: The protection service’s agents must have more education and experience than its uniformed officers, who were on duty the day a man with a knife ran through the front door of the White House.
abstract: Some see disparity between Secret Service's agents and its uniformed officers, issue the service says it is investigating in response to intense criticism it has received over White House security lapses; agents have more education and experience than uniformed officers, who were on duty when a man with a knife ran into the White House; questions are being raised about problems with morale, turnover and training.
lead_paragraph: The protection service’s agents must have more education and experience than its uniformed officers, who were on duty the day a man with a knife ran through the front door of the White House.
